author: Brooks Barnes
text:
A Hogwarts Express train conductor in the Wizarding World of Harry Potter at the new themed area at Universal Studios Hollywood in Los Angeles.— Photo: NYT

Six years ago, when Universal Parks & Resorts opened the Wizarding World of Harry Potter in Orlando, Florida, the initial experience was less than magical.

It was a sweltering June day. The main attraction, a simulated broom ride, proved a little too rambunctious, leaving entire families with motion sickness. At one point, the line to get into Hogsmeade village was nine hours long.

Now comes the cross-country expansion. Universal Studios Hollywood will unveil its own Wizarding World on April 7. Although the Potter movie series ended in 2011 calling into question continuing interest in the boy wizard, analysts expect the Hollywood park’s overall attendance to increase immediately by more than 20 per cent.

Universal has introduced a demand-based ticket pricing system aimed at preventing overcrowding. And it has tweaked the Hogsmeade blueprints to add capacity. The broom ride — this time in 3-D — is still making some people vomit, though. — New York Times News Service
title: A peek inside Harry Potter’s Hollywood world
